Description: Pottery jug in Red Slip ware of Roman date; bulbous globular body on a ring base; tall neck and very deep, rectangular rim; angular handle from shoulder to neck; buff clay with a thin, matt red slip (worn in many places).
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Horatio Herbert Kitchener, Earl Kitchener of Khartoum
Curator's comments: The number '9' in blue pencil on the base of the vase appears to relate to the original find spot: see Bailey, Op. Ath. VI (1965), pp. 5-13 for details of the Hake-Kitchener excavations.
Acquisition name: Transferred from: Victoria and Albert Museum
